problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.initialization: ITEMS : Annotated[list[Item], Len(20, 20)] = [ITEM1, ITEM2, ITEM3, ITEM4, ITEM5, ITEM6, ITEM7, ITEM8, ITEM9, ITEM10, ITEM11, ITEM12, ITEM13, ITEM14, ITEM15, ITEM16, ITEM17, ITEM18, ITEM19, ITEM20]

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
) -> None:
    # For each item, ensure it fits within the box dimensions
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item: Item = items[i]
        pos: Position = positions[i]
        box_id: int = assignments[i]
        
        # Ensure item does not exceed box width
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        
        # Ensure item does not exceed box height
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_between_items(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
) -> None:
    # For each pair of items, ensure they do not overlap if in the same box
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Assert that at least one axis does not overlap (i.e., rectangles do not overlap)
                assert (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)

no_overlap_between_items(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    # Ensure each item is assigned to exactly one box (already implied by variable bounds)
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_between_items(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
) -> None:
    # For each pair of items, ensure they do not overlap if in the same box
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Ensure items do not overlap using rectangle intersection logic

                assert (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or

    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
) -> None:
    # Each item must be placed in exactly one box (already ensured by domain of assignments)
    # Additionally, ensure that positions are non-negative and within possible bounds
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure x position is valid (non-negative and allows item to fit)
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        
        # Ensure y position is valid (non-negative and allows item to fit)
        assert positions[i].y >= 0
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT

ensure_item_assignment_and_position(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

# Object type for the position (x, y) of an item within a box
Position = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 100
BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 18, "height": 27}, {"width": 99, "height": 71}, {"width": 49, "height": 30}, {"width": 37, "height": 45}, {"width": 7, "height": 35}, {"width": 28, "height": 45}, {"width": 93, "height": 94}, {"width": 21, "height": 24}, {"width": 7, "height": 5}, {"width": 18, "height": 31}, {"width": 99, "height": 20}, {"width": 18, "height": 76}, {"width": 68, "height": 87}, {"width": 21, "height": 28}, {"width": 77, "height": 7}, {"width": 26, "height": 18}, {"width": 42, "height": 30}, {"width": 34, "height": 37}, {"width": 96, "height": 56}, {"width": 97, "height": 33}]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)
item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=20):
    max_box: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---

    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),

    box_width: int,

    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure items fit within the box boundaries
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        # Ensure positions are non-negative (already constrained by Position definition)
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

fit_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

):

        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box

                # Check if rectangles overlap
                # Overlap exists if both horizontal and vertical projections overlap
                assert not (

def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=20):
    max_box: DSInt(lb=1, ub=20) = 1
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_right_edge: int = positions[i].x + items[i].width
        item_bottom_edge: int = positions[i].y + items[i].height
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0
        assert item_right_edge <= box_width
        assert item_bottom_edge <= box_height

ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- constraints ---
def ensure_no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check if rectangles overlap
                # Overlap exists if both horizontal and vertical projections overlap
                assert not (
                    (positions[i].x < positions[j].x + items[j].width) and 
                    (positions[j].x < positions[i].x + items[i].width) and
                    (positions[i].y < positions[j].y + items[j].height) and
                    (positions[j].y < positions[i].y + items[i].height)
                )

ensure_no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)
